intro: Acronia callifera, commonly known as the yellow-tipped acronia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have a yellowish or greenish hue. Acronia callifera is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils.
